intro: Sophora bhutanica, commonly known as the Bhutanese Sophora, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in rocky soils. It produces pods containing edible seeds, which are sometimes used in traditional cuisine. Its ecological importance includes nitrogen fixation, which enriches the soil in its native habitat.
